Name: Acceptance Criteria - Current revision of drawings, technical specifications, permits as required for excavation and any other construction documentation is being utilised by Fulton Hogan and subcontractors.
○ Current revisions of these documents to be obtained via Aconex.
Reference Documents - Current revisions in Aconex
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - A linemarking plan showing which lines are to be removed and which lines are to be applied needs to be approved by the Contract Administrator prior to commencement.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
1.3 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WMS.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, WMS, SWMS
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Plant and equipment used in the works are appropriate to achieve specification requirements.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - The paint to be used shall be a premixed synthetic latex-based paint (such as WATTYL AIRPAVE or approved equivalent).
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - The paint Is to be packaged in 20 litre containers that are of durable construction without sharp edges. Paint containers are to be clearly labelled “Airport Pavement Marking Paint” as well as being labelled with the following: Manufacturer’s name, Colour, Batch number and Date.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall carry out the setting out of the pavement Markings as shown on the drawings. This shall be approved by the Principal’s Representative.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria - Existing pavement markings, at the locations shown on the Drawings, shall be removed by water blasting or other approved means that is non-destructive to the existing pavement surface.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative

Acceptance Criteria - The surface of the asphalt or concrete pavement in the areas to be painted shall be thoroughly cleaned prior to the application of the pavement marking paint. This shall be approved by the Principal’s Representative.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - Pavement marking shall not proceed during wet weather or when the pavement surface is wet or when rain is likely or during high winds.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - The paint must be applied in two even coats to provide the required minimum total dry film thickness for the two different paints are:
○ The second coat is to be applied no less than three days following the initial coat.
Reference Documents - Beca Spec 002 15.8 / Manufacture rs Specs
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
2.5 - Application Rate and Conformity of Application
Acceptance Criteria - Daily records of paint usage and the area covered shall be maintained by the Contractor.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed / Daily Records
Acceptance Criteria - Finished pavement markings shall conform to the following tolerances:
– Width of any line or line forming an alpha/numeric symbol ±5mm
– Length of any line and the spacing of broken lines ±50mm

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in a ccordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
